snippet: The hard-fought changes curb the power of the police and prosecutors to detain suspects without notifying relatives, to use evidence extracted by torture and to keep defense lawyers at bay.
abstract: Chinese government moves to adopt several amendments to its Criminal Procedure Law to enhance the rights of suspects and defendants in criminal cases; recommends that national legislature adopt a series of Western-style safeguards in the most sweeping revisions to its criminal procedure code since 1996.

byline.contributor: Li Bibo and Mia Li contributed research.

lead_paragraph: The hard-fought changes curb the power of the police and prosecutors to detain suspects without notifying relatives, to use evidence extracted by torture and to keep defense lawyers at bay.

headline.main: China Acts to Give Defendants Greater Rights
headline.print_headline: China Acts to Bolster Defendants’ Rights
